heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 7.0°C), feels like temperature (down 6.9°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 12%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 1078 m) and light levels (up 9427 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8980 lux) and cloud levels (up 700 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1078.4m lower than yesterday, 699.7m lower than the past week, 310.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1078m to a maximum of 4940m, averaging 1411.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 2110m and 1721.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and winds will be practically absent. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.4°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
